Introduction
============

Welcome to the Nico Documentation!

NiCo(Niche Covariation) is a tool designed for the comprehensive analysis of single-cell spatial transcriptomics data. This documentation provides detailed instructions on how to use the tool, including installation, usage examples, and API references.

Key Features:
-------------

- **Cell Type Annotation:** Accurately annotate cell types based on spatial transcriptomics data.
- **Spatial Neighborhood Analysis:** Identify and analyze cell type-cell type interactions within spatial neighborhoods.
- **Visualization Tools:** Generate UMAP plots and spatial maps to visualize cell types and their interactions.

Getting Started:
----------------

To get started with NiCo, follow the [installation instructions](installation.html) and refer to the [usage guide](usage.html) for detailed examples and tutorials.
